messages.text:
Hmm, I tried to port that to batch,
```@echo off
set JULIA=C:\Tools\Julia\julia-dev\bin\julia.exe
setlocal enableDelayedExpansion

IF "%JULIA_LANGUAGESERVER%"=="" (start wt %JULIA% %*) ELSE (start %JULIA% %*)```

elements.text: Hmm, I tried to port that to batch,

@echo off
set JULIA=C:\Tools\Julia\julia-dev\bin\julia.exe
setlocal enableDelayedExpansion

IF "%JULIA_LANGUAGESERVER%"=="" (start wt %JULIA% %*) ELSE (start %JULIA% %*)

messages.text: In the meantime we can just make Fredrik's workaround in <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/external-julia-repl-in-vscode/50745> more first class (as it was in Juno).

attachments.title: External Julia REPL in VSCode
attachments.text: Someone recently asked in Slack if it was possible to to launch the Julia REPL process in a separate window (i.e. a separate terminal) and have that hooked up with the Julia extension such that you can send code to it from the editor. This can be pretty useful, for example, if you have a second monitor where you want to keep the REPL and thus make it possible to maximize the editor window on the first monitor. I figured out a way of doing it and just wanted to share this since it might be usefu...
attachments.fallback: JuliaLang: External Julia REPL in VSCode

messages.text:
Is it common to experience the "Possible method call error" warning with valid code that calls a function with named arguments? (`Lint: Call` is enabled)

```add2(;x::Number)::Number  = x + 2

@show y = add2(x=3::Int) #Possible method call error```
The "possible" in the warning suggests this feature is still being worked on, and I might just need to disable it for now and be patient. But I'm new to Julia and it's equally likely I'm writing or setting up something wrong :sweat_smile:. Thanks!

elements.text: Is it common to experience the "Possible method call error" warning with valid code that calls a function with named arguments? (
Lint: Call
is enabled)

add2(;x::Number)::Number  = x + 2

@show y = add2(x=3::Int) #Possible method call error

The "possible" in the warning suggests this feature is still being worked on, and I might just need to disable it for now and be patient. But I'm new to Julia and it's equally likely I'm writing or setting up something wrong
. Thanks!
